lines.text: Well, you were born and raised in this town too, missy!
Yes, uh, yes, but I chose to rise above the attitudes of this small town, while you chose to lay spread over a gravestone and take them inside you!
Mona!!!
Shh! Listen. A slowly passing train is so romantic.
Time is such a nebulous date to wait for.
And patience, they say, is a virtue.
Mona, it was so horrible and I was so damn scared and when I tried to scream for help, they just kept punchin' me in the face! And he kept callin' me Joanne!
I just love to try an' guess at people from old photographs.
You look like you done pretty well for yourself.
As well as might be expected.
Jo, why did you have to come back here?
I had as much right to return to this reunion as anybody, didn't I?
Those awful things you said about my Sidney were lies, and I want you to tell everybody they were lies!
Sidney is dead, Jo, so let's just forget it, huh?
Gee, Juanita, I thought this night was dedicated to remembering those days... that made us all what we are today.
You're just one of them perverts, that's what you are!
Well, that's what you always thought I was, Juanita.
Believin' is so funny, isn't it? When what you believe in doesn't even know you exist.
Well, you ain't bringin' beer in here.
Could you just, um, turn God off for tonight and have yourself a good time?
Christ, anybody can be happy. Look at me, I laugh my ass off all the damn time. You know, I'll laugh at just about anything.
You're not happy.
I'm happy Goddammit!
I wonder what made God turn away from me like that.
I just think, um, there's so many people in the world nowadays, it's hard for him to give the personal attention that he used to.
I had such a very nice time. Thank you all for likin' me and bein' so nice to me although I'm not very smart.
You know, I never could stand people who keep sayin' they're gonna go and then they never do.
Prosperity, unfortunately, it's a fleeting thing.
He is a sick boy and should be treated before he grows up into a communist.
You do far too much messing around. I'm going to ask my Friday Bible Club to devote a prayer session to you.
Why dont you pray for them people in China? They need it a hell of a lot more than I do.
We were praying for them, but it didn't seem to do much good. Now we pray for rain.
De ja vu.
[first lines]
Jimmy Dean? Jimmy Dean! Come on back here to the five-and-dime now, Jimmy Dean. Jimmy Dean, you're out here, I know you are.
